itemDescription: (1839-1921), High Court Judge and Principal of the Court of Arches

wikipedia_page.main: Sir Arthur Charles (23 January 1839 – 20 November 1921) was a British lawyer and High Court judge. A distinguished ecclesiastical lawyer, Charles is today best remembered for presiding over the first trial of Oscar Wilde for gross indecency.

response: *The Rt. Hon. Sir Arthur Charles (OG 1848–54), Judge of the High Court

* Sir Arthur Charles (judge) (1839–1921), English High Court judge
* Sir Arthur Eber Sydney Charles (1910–1965), Speaker of the Legislative Council of Aden, see Assassination of Sir Arthur Charles

Ernest Charles was the son of the High Court judge Sir Arthur Charles. He was educated at Clifton College and New College, Oxford, where he read Jurisprudence. He was called to the Bar at the Inner Temple in 1896, and acquired a large general practice on the Western Circuit and in London. He was appointed a King's Counsel in 1913 and became a Bencher of his Inn in 1922.
